acceptArmyInBattle(address,uint256).details: Even though function is opened, it can only be called by world asset

params.side: Side to which army will join

calculateAllCasualties().details: Uses values from battles' sideUnitsCount in order to calculate casualties (can be executed while battle is still not fully formed)

returns._2: Winning side (0 - both sides lost, 1 - side A Won, 2 - side B Won

calculateArmyCasualties(address).details: Provides valid results only for finished battle

params.armyAddress: Address of army presented in battle

returns._1: Amount of casualties for related unit types

calculateStage1Casualties().details: Uses values from battles' sideUnitsCount in order to calculate casualties (can be executed while battle is still not fully formed)

returns.stageParams: Stage params (encoded abi.encode(sideAOffense, sideBOffense, sideADefence, sideBDefence))

calculateStage2Casualties(uint256[],uint.details: Uses values from battles' sideUnitsCount in order to calculate casualties (can be executed while battle is still not fully formed)

returns.stageParams: Stage params (encoded abi.encode(sideAOffense, sideBOffense, sideADefence, sideBDefence))

calculateTimings(uint256,uint256,uint256.details: globalMultiplier, baseLobbyDuration, baseOngoingDuration parameters from registry

params.units1: Amount of units from attacker army
params.units2: Amount of units from attacked army

canFinishBattle().details: Checks if finishTime is set and current block.timestamp > creationTime + lobbyDuration + ongoingDuration

epoch().details: Value is dereferenced from proxy storage and world

getSideALength().details: Basically returns length of sideA array

returns._0: Amount of armies joined to side A

getSideBLength().details: Basically returns length of sideA array

returns._0: Amount of armies joined to side B

getTimings(bool,uint256,uint256,uint256).details: Returns same value as #calculateTimings but without the need to provide all parameters

init(address,address).details: Called by factory contract which creates current instance

isFinishedBattle().details: Checks if finishTime is not zero

removeArmyFromBattle(address).details: Even though function is opened, it can only be called by world asset

world().details: Value is dereferenced from proxy storage

armyUnitsCount.return: Amount of units by army address and unit type

returns._0: Amount of units by army address and unit type

params.side: Side of which query casualties amount (sideA = 1, sideB = 2)

casualties.return: Amount of casualties by side and unit type

returns._0: Amount of casualties by side and unit type

position.details: Immutable, initialized on the battle creation

sideA.details: Updated when army joins side A
sideA.return: Army address at the specified index

returns._0: Army address at the specified index

sideB.details: Updated when army joins side B
sideB.return: Army address at the specified index

returns._0: Army address at the specified index

params.side: Side of which query units amount (sideA = 1, sideB = 2)

sideUnitsCount.return: Amount of units by specified side and unit type

returns._0: Amount of units by specified side and unit type

timing.details: Updated when battle initialized, first armies joined and finished (#initBattle, #acceptArmyInBattle, #startBattle)

returns.lobbyDuration: Lobby duration, initialized when first two armies joined
returns.ongoingDuration: Ongoing duration, initialized when first two armies joined

armySide(address).notice: Mapping that contains side at which joined army is on

armyUnitsCount(address,string).notice: Mapping that contains amount of units by army address and unit type

calculateAllCasualties().notice: Calculates casualties for all battle stages

calculateStage1Casualties().notice: Calculates casualties for first battle stage

calculateStage2Casualties(uint256[],uint.notice: Calculates casualties for second battle stage (based on casualties from first battle stage)

calculateTimings(uint256,uint256,uint256.notice: Calculates lobby duration and ongoing duration based on specified parameters

canFinishBattle().notice: Calculates if battle can be finished

casualties(uint256,string).notice: Mapping that contains amount of casualties after battle is finished

getSideALength().notice: Calculates amount of armies joined to side A

getSideBLength().notice: Calculates amount of armies joined to side B

position().notice: Position at which battle is being held

sideA(uint256).notice: An array of armies joined to side A

sideB(uint256).notice: An array of armies joined to side B

sideUnitsCount(uint256,string).notice: Mapping that contains units amount by side and unit type
